Package edu.ucalgary.oop

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucalgary.oop.Client
  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Client is a client for the user to interact with that generates a schedule based on the database provided After called by the GUI, the client is created

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Client()
      Constructor that connects to the MySQL database and retrieves data

    • Method Detail

      • buildSchedule

        public void buildSchedule()
                   throws VolunteerNeededException,
                          VetNeededException
        Creates a schedule which will throw VolunteerNeededException if there are any volunteer needed.
        Throws:
        VolunteerNeededException - throws the volunteerNeededException given from Schedule
        VetNeededException - throws the exception given from Schedule

      • uploadSchedule

        public void uploadSchedule()
        uploadSchedule() will create a new schedule object with the data obtained. It will throw a VolunteerNeededException which will be passed to the GUI. NOTE THAT THE SCHEDULE OBJECT SHOULD HAVE BE A MATRIX OF FORMATTED STRINGS (set the example .txt file for details)

      • changeMedicalTask

        public void changeMedicalTask​(Task newTask)
        Changes the old task with the same id as the new given task
        Parameters:
        newTask - the task to be added into the database

      • getTasks

        public java.util.ArrayList<Task> getTasks​(int id)
        Returns all tasks that match the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the wanted task(s)
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of treatments that matches the given id
